tags.name: authentication
tags.description:
All API calls in this document require an `ApiKey`. 

 - You can obtain the `ApiKey` from the My page in the upper right corner after logging into the XRCLOUD page.

tags.name: project
tags.description:
A Project in XRCLOUD can be a developer's project, platform, or a 3rd-party application. It is a unit that manages Scenes and Rooms, with multiple Scenes and Rooms belonging to a specific Project. 

 - The `webhookUrl` can be set when creating or modifying a Project on the XRCLOUD page.

tags.name: scene
tags.description:
A space for creating web-based 3D virtual spaces, necessary for creating Rooms. 

 By calling the [get-creation-url api](#operation/GetSceneCreationUrl), you can access the 'sceneCreationUrl' field to access the editor (Spoke) and create a Scene by clicking the Publish Scene button in the upper right corner. Additionally, by calling the [get-scene api](#operation/GetScene), you can access the 'sceneModificationUrl' field to make modifications. 

 - The `optId` value is a callback value used to verify the creation and modification of a Scene in XRCLOUD. Modifying it may cause errors.

tags.name: room
tags.description:
A Room is a space composed of a Scene created through the editor (Spoke). 

 Each Room has a private room URL that changes with each information request and a public room URL with a fixed address. These URLs are also divided into a host URL that grants host permissions and a guest URL that grants guest permissions. 

 The 'returnUrl' refers to the web address to return to when leaving the room, and it can be set in the Rooms tab of XRCloud.

get.description: Fetch projects filtered by label. Use the `label` query parameter to filter projects by a specific label.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The label of the project to filter. If not provided, all projects will be returned.

default.description: Errors such as 4XX or 5XX may occur depending on the situation.

post.description:
You can create a project using the following format:

```
RES=$(curl -s -X POST "$XRCLOUD_HOST/api/projects" \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer $ACCESS_TOKEN" \
    -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
    -F "favicon=@$FILE_DIR/favicon.ico" \
    -F "logo=@$FILE_DIR/logo.png" \
    -F "name=lms" \
    -F "label=lms"
)
```

This API uses `multipart/form-data` format to include the favicon, logo, name, and label of the project.

default.description: Errors such as 4XX or 5XX may occur depending on the situation.

get.summary: Retrieve or Generate XRCLOUD User ID
get.description: Pass a user ID from your service to generate and retrieve a reticulumId (XRCLOUD's user ID) in XRCLOUD. This user ID is used in other APIs to identify specific user actions on the platform. Logging information will be reported using this reticulumId.

default.description: Errors such as 4XX or 5XX may occur depending on the situation.

get.description: Retrieve the user's participation logs for a specific room. This log includes the time, IP address, device information, etc. of the user who joined the room. (As of 2024-12-01, the IP address and UserAgent are not being sent correctly.)

default.description: Errors such as 4XX or 5XX may occur depending on the situation.

ApiKey.name: X-XRCLOUD-API-KEY
ApiKey.description: You must include the `ApiKey` in the header in the following format: `X-XRCLOUD-API-KEY: ${ApiKey}`.

PaginationTake.name: take
PaginationTake.description: (pagination) The number of items to retrieve.

PaginationSkip.name: skip
PaginationSkip.description: (pagination) The number of items to skip.

Name.name: name
Name.description: (search) Retrieve objects with the specified name.

Creator.name: creator
Creator.description: (search) Retrieve objects created by a specific creator.

SceneCreateCreator.name: creator
SceneCreateCreator.description: You can specify the creator of the Scene. It is used to distinguish between 'My Assets' for each user. If you call without this parameter, it will be treated as if it was created by 'Admin'.

SceneCreateCallback.name: callback
SceneCreateCallback.description:
You can call this if you need a specific action after creating the Scene (such as creating a Room immediately after creating the Scene). The call from XRCloud will be as follows. 

 { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify({ sceneId }) }

UserId.name: userId
UserId.description: User of the Project (app). It is used to distinguish between users who enter the Room.

AvatarUrl.name: avatarUrl
AvatarUrl.description: The path to the avatar file for the Room.

LinkPayload.name: linkPayload
LinkPayload.description: The value to be passed to the 'InlineView' element of the Scene. It will be passed to the URL called by the InlineView in the hubsParam parameter.

statusCode.description: HTTP status code. The actual value varies depending on the error.

method.description: HTTP method of the request that caused the error.

url.description: The endpoint that returned this error. This value varies depending on the endpoint.

body.description: The original data sent in the request body. The actual value varies depending on the request.

message.description: Detailed error message explaining the error.

webhookUrl.description:
The endpoint of the external system that sends event information when a user enters or exits the Room. The Room enter/exit information will be sent as a POST request to the URL. You can use this value to record the user's activity. 
  Note: As of 2024-12-01, the IP and UserAgent values are not being sent correctly. 

 Example: 

 ```json
 {
   "code": "room-join",
   "resourceId": "c322b49b-6e12-47d9-b293-b5ab3727459c",
   "sessionId": "4f7edfb6-b8a1-4f58-96ee-1deb4da98740",
   "reticulumId": "0934212312120(XRCLOUD's user ID for getRoom, the userId will be created.)",
   "logTime": "2023-12-12T09:27:41.600Z",
   "action": "enter",
   "ip": "123.0.0.1",
   "userAgent": "Mozilla/5.0",
   "device": "VR"
 }
 ```

createdAt.description: Date and time when the Project was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the Project was last updated.

faviconUrl.description: URL of the favicon of the Project.

logoUrl.description: URL of the logo of the Project.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the Scene was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the Scene was last updated.

sceneModificationUrl.description: URL of the space to modify the Scene.

size.description: Maximum number of people that can enter the Room.

tags.description: (Before Use) Field to distinguish specific Rooms.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the Room was created.

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the Room was last updated.

returnUrl.description: URL to return to when leaving the Room.

public.description: Users cannot distinguish between URLs that do not change. Users cannot distinguish between URLs that do not change.

private.description: Users can distinguish between URLs that change with each request to get the URL. Users can distinguish between URLs that change with each request to get the URL.

skip.description: Number of items skipped for pagination.

take.description: Number of items retrieved for pagination.

sceneCreationUrl.description: URL of the space to create the Scene.

returnUrl.description: URL to return to when leaving the Room.

size.description: Maximum number of people that can enter the Room.

skip.description: Number of items skipped for pagination.

take.description: Number of items retrieved for pagination.

id.description: Unique ID of the entrance/exit log.

infraUserId.description: User ID of the 3rd-party application that entered the Room.

joinedAt.description: Date and time when the user entered the Room.

exitedAt.description: Date and time when the user exited the Room.

size.description: Maximum number of people that can enter the Room.

returnUrl.description: URL to return to when leaving the Room.
